items.title: Alan Bergman, Half of a Prolific Lyric-Writing Team, Dies at 99
items.description: With his wife, Marilyn, he wrote the words to memorable TV theme songs and the Oscar-winning “The Way We Were” and “The Windmills of Your Mind.”

items.title: Trump’s NPR and PBS Funding Cuts Were Decades in the Making
items.description: The cuts speak to President Trump’s grip on his party but also to the sweeping changes in media.

items.title: Bolsonaro, Brazil’s Former President, Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor Before Trial

items.title: The Impact of Defunding NPR and PBS
items.description: Congress just voted to claw back $500 million in funding for public broadcasting. Benjamin Mullin, a media reporter for The New York Times, explains w...

items.title: The Seeds of Democratic Revival Have Already Been Sown
items.description: The party is getting pummeled. But it can fight back.
